explains: n. 平衡力，抗衡力；抵消因素，制约力
v. 对……起平衡作用，抵消

sentences.en: Perhaps you have awful faults to counterbalance your few good points.
sentences.cn: 也许你有可怕的缺点来抵消你不多的优点。

sentences.en: The accused's right to silence was a vital counterbalance to the powers of the police.
sentences.cn: 被告人的沉默权对警方的权力是一种至关重要的抗衡。

sentences.en: Advertisers sometimes offset or counterbalance an exaggerated claim with a disclaimer—a qualification or condition on the claim.
sentences.cn: "广告商有时会通过补偿或者免责的形式，即对索赔要求的一种限定或条件，来平衡夸大的说辞。
